Name: Study Guide and Selected Solutions Manual for Physics, Volume 1

ReviewList.Text: This was useful when I used it.  The explanation is different from the text, which is nice. There are some example questions, which are much easier than most professor's test (so take this as a warning).  The useful part was the worked out problems at the end of each study review.  There were about 5-10 worked out details of problems from the book. Having said that, this book CANNOT replace the textbook because it just wont make sense this way.  If you have a cramster.com subscription, than this book would be a waste of money for you because you already have the details to all of the books problems listed there.  I took of one star because the study guide does not provide very many solutions, and only covers half of the book.

The manual does not have very many solutions directly related to or even similar to the odd questions in the book.  I bought the study guide and solution manual in hopes of getting direct, thorough, how-to answers for many of the questions in the excercies.  I found it frustrating not being able to find very many solutions (more than just answers) of the excercises in each chapter.  I may help as a study guide, but it gives very few solutions to the excercises!

I purchased this to accompany the textbook thinking I could use it to do the homework problems but have not used it. I tried once but didn't really find it to offer anything worthwhile so I have not used it at all.
I was expected more solutions to problems but here are only about 5 for each chapter when there are 100 in the textbook.
